meanings.sent1: The doctor will revaccinate the patient to ensure full protection.
meanings.sent2: After a year, it is recommended to revaccinate against the flu.
meanings.sent3: The cat was not thrilled to be revaccinated, but it was for her own good.
meanings.sent4: Just like updating software, revaccinating helps keep the body's defenses strong.
meanings.sent5: Don't forget to revaccinate regularly to stay healthy and safe.

meanings.definition: To administer a vaccine for a second time.
meanings.sent1: The nurse will revaccinate the child to boost immunity.
meanings.sent2: It is common practice to revaccinate before traveling to certain countries.
meanings.sent3: The dog wagged its tail happily after being revaccinated, thinking it was a treat.
meanings.sent4: Revaccinating is like giving the immune system a friendly reminder to stay alert.
meanings.sent5: The school requires students to revaccinate to prevent outbreaks of diseases.
